dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong
News Content: Heading into 2023, Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway's (NYSE: BRK.A)(NYSE: BRK.B) had a substantial investment in General Motors(NYSE: GM). According to Berkshire's SEC filings, the conglomerate owned 50 million shares of GM at the beginning of that year, worth about $1.7 billion at the time.

Throughout 2023, Buffett unloaded all of Berkshire's General Motors stock. However, I think he made the wrong decision. Not only is General Motors up by more than 55% since the end of the quarter when Berkshire sold, but the company is also doing a great job of maximizing profits and creating shareholder value.

Lots to like about this "legacy" automaker

Even though Buffett sold GM, there's quite a bit to like about the stock right now.

For one thing, the business has been surprisingly resilient, given the combination of higher interest rates and more cautious consumer spending. In the company's third-quarter 2024 earnings, the latest reported, GM surprised investors with both top- and bottom-line results that handily surpassed expectations, as well as an increase in its full-year earnings guidance.

Then, at its October 2024 investor day, management surprised the market, which expected a slowdown, by saying that its 2025 adjusted earnings will be in a "similar range" to 2024.

Other recent news has been quite encouraging as well. GM reported that its 2024 sales increased by 4% and that its market share increased overall and doubled in the case of electric vehicles. Deliveries in China increased by 40.6% sequentially in the fourth quarter.

Another recent development is that GM will pivot its Cruise autonomous strategy away from developing robotaxis and toward developing its Super Cruise autonomous technology for personal vehicles. This move alone is expected to save the company more than $1 billion annually.

GM is also aggressively using excess capital to buy back shares. Since late 2023, when GM announced an accelerated buyback program, the company's outstanding share count has declined by 21%, and there could be more buybacks ahead, especially considering the stronger-than-expected 2025 outlook and the fact that it hopefully won't be sinking as much money into automation. It's also worth noting that since the buyback was announced, GM's stock is up by more than 40%.

It's not too surprising that GM is being so aggressive with buybacks. The stock trades for just 5.5 times trailing-12-month earnings and 5.1 times forward earnings. If GM can achieve its 2025 targets and execute well on its growth plans, the stock could be a tremendous bargain.

Story Continues

Why did Buffett sell?

Buffett hasn't specified his reasons for selling General Motors. But it's worth noting that he has been a net seller of stocks for the past couple of years and has aggressively reduced some of Berkshire's largest investments, including the massive stakes in Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) and Bank of America(NYSE: BAC).

My instinct is that he sold because of some of the perceived risk factors with the stock. At the time of the sales, many experts were forecasting new auto demand to fall more than it actually did, and in the fall of 2023, there was a strike by auto workers that cost GM an estimated $800 million.

Whatever the reasons Buffett had for selling might be, I think he's wrong, and I don't often say that about Buffett's moves. GM is doing a fantastic job of keeping its sales and profit high, and I think this could be one of the biggest bargains in the stock market right now.

Should you invest $1,000 in General Motors right now?

Before you buy stock in General Motors, consider this:

The Motley Fool Stock Advisor analyst team just identified what they believe are the 10 best stocks for investors to buy now… and General Motors wasn’t one of them. The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years.

Consider when Nvidia made this list on April 15, 2005... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation, you’d have $843,960!*

Stock Advisor provides investors with an easy-to-follow blueprint for success, including guidance on building a portfolio, regular updates from analysts, and two new stock picks each month. TheStock Advisorservice has more than quadrupled the return of S&P 500 since 2002*.

See the 10 stocks »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 13, 2025

Bank of America is an advertising partner of Motley Fool Money. Matt Frankel has positions in Bank of America, Berkshire Hathaway, and General Motors. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Apple, Bank of America, and Berkshire Hathaway. The Motley Fool recommends General Motors and recommends the following options: long January 2025 $25 calls on General Motors. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news highlights both positive and negative aspects regarding Apple Inc. (AAPL). On one hand, the company has shown financial growth with a revenue increase and is launching new products with AI features, which could attract investor interest. On the other hand, the mention of billionaire Chen Tianqiao dumping some tech stocks, including AAPL, may raise concerns among investors about the stock's future performance. However, the overall positive outlook on Apple's innovations and financials suggests a higher likelihood of stock price increase compared to a decrease.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news is predominantly negative for Apple. Two downgrades from reputable firms (Jefferies and Loop Capital) citing weak iPhone sales and a lack of AI traction are significant. The specific concerns about declining iPhone sales in China, overall market share decline, and lower revenue forecasts all point to potential downward pressure on the stock. While new product releases are mentioned, their impact is uncertain and doesn't outweigh the immediate negative sentiment. The fact that the stock already fell 3.7% midday Tuesday confirms the market's initial negative reaction. The underperformance of Apple stock compared to its Big Tech peers and the S&P 500 further strengthens the bearish outlook. The upcoming earnings report on Jan 30th will be crucial, but the lowered expectations set by Jefferies suggest a higher likelihood of a negative surprise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: Jefferies, a reputable financial firm, has downgraded Apple's rating to 'Underperform' citing concerns about weakening iPhone demand, slower-than-expected AI adoption, and challenges in its advanced packaging roadmap.  These concerns are supported by IDC data showing a 4% year-over-year decline in iPhone shipments and the potential impact of Chinese subsidy policies.  The lowered price target of $200.75 from $211.84 further reinforces a bearish outlook. While Apple's Q1 earnings report could potentially offer a counter-narrative, the current news strongly suggests a negative market reaction. The pre-market and current trading day's price drop of approximately 3.8% already reflects a significant portion of this negative sentiment. However, it's important to note that market reactions can be unpredictable, and positive surprises or other market factors could influence the stock price.  Therefore, while the probability of a price fall is higher, a complete disregard for the possibility of a rise is unwarranted.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's decision to sell General Motors (GM) stock, which the author believes was a mistake given GM's strong performance, including a 55% increase in stock price post-sale, better-than-expected earnings, increased market share, and aggressive share buybacks. The author highlights GM's resilience, positive earnings guidance, and strategic pivot in autonomous technology as reasons for optimism. However, the article does not directly impact Apple Inc. (AAPL), as the focus is on GM. The mention of Buffett reducing Berkshire's stake in Apple is tangential and does not provide new negative information about Apple's fundamentals. Therefore, the news is unlikely to significantly affect Apple's stock price.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses billionaire Chen Tianqiao's investment activities, specifically mentioning Apple Inc. (AAPL) as one of the stocks in his portfolio. Shanda Asset Management holds a $116.5 million stake in AAPL. The article highlights Apple's positive financial growth, upcoming product launches with AI features, and collaborations with OpenAI. These factors are likely to be viewed positively by investors. However, the article also mentions that AAPL ranks 3rd on the list of stocks Chen Tianqiao dumped and bet on, suggesting that Chen might be reducing his exposure to AAPL. The overall sentiment seems mixed but slightly positive due to the emphasis on AI innovations and financial growth.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article highlights three Warren Buffett stocks with potential upside in 2025, including Apple Inc. (AAPL). According to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives, Apple's integration of artificial intelligence (AI) solutions into its products and its transformation as a services provider could boost consumer demand and enhance brand loyalty. Additionally, Apple's world-leading capital-return program has provided significant value to shareholders. However, the article also notes that Apple stock is historically pricey relative to its trailing-12-month EPS, which might be a concern for value investors. Given the positive outlook from the analyst and the company's strong fundamentals, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The news highlights multiple downgrades and lowered price targets due to weak iPhone sales and lackluster AI performance. Analysts expect lower-than-anticipated financial results, and current market trends show a negative sentiment towards the stock. The recent stock price drop further indicates investor concerns. While new product rollouts might provide some upside, the immediate impact of the negative news outweighs any potential positive developments.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news presents a mixed outlook for Apple Inc. (AAPL). On one hand, the company has shown financial growth with a revenue increase and is launching new products with AI features, which could attract investor interest. However, the mention of billionaire Chen Tianqiao dumping some tech stocks, including AAPL, raises concerns about the stock's future performance. Additionally, there are significant bearish sentiments from other analysts regarding weak iPhone sales and AI adoption. Given the conflicting signals, I estimate a slightly higher probability of the stock price rising due to the positive aspects of financial growth and product innovation, but the overall sentiment remains cautious due to the negative news surrounding the stock.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The news is overwhelmingly negative. Two downgrades from reputable firms (Jefferies and Loop Capital) citing weak iPhone sales, particularly in China, and a lack of traction in AI are significant concerns. The lowered price targets reinforce this bearish outlook. The article also highlights declining iPhone market share and lower revenue forecasts. While new product releases are mentioned, their potential impact is overshadowed by the immediate negative sentiment. The stock's recent drop of 3.7% confirms the market's initial negative reaction. The underperformance of Apple stock compared to its Big Tech peers and the S&P 500 further strengthens the bearish outlook. Considering the previous rounds of predictions, there's a clear consensus forming towards a negative outlook, with the majority of models predicting a higher probability of the stock price falling. The negative information outweighs any potential positive catalysts in the short term.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.2, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.8, Reasoning: The news is overwhelmingly negative for Apple.  Jefferies' downgrade to 'Underperform', coupled with the cited reasons (slowing iPhone demand, weaker-than-expected AI adoption, and challenges in advanced packaging), paints a bearish picture.  The IDC data supporting the iPhone shipment decline and the potential impact of Chinese subsidies further strengthens this negative outlook. The pre-market and intraday price drop of approximately 3.8% reflects the immediate market reaction to this negative news. While Apple's Q1 earnings could potentially offer a positive surprise, the current information strongly suggests a higher probability of a price fall.  The previous predictions show a range of opinions, but the majority lean towards a price fall, particularly those models that directly analyze the provided news.  My prediction incorporates this consensus and the weight of the negative news presented.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses Warren Buffett's decision to sell General Motors (GM) stock and the author's disagreement with this move, highlighting GM's strong performance post-sale. While the article mentions Buffett reducing Berkshire's stake in Apple (AAPL), it does not provide any new negative information about Apple's fundamentals or performance. The focus remains on GM, and the tangential mention of Apple is unlikely to significantly impact AAPL's stock price. Given the lack of direct negative or positive news about Apple, the stock price is expected to remain relatively stable with a slight bias towards stability or minor fluctuations.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses billionaire Chen Tianqiao's investment activities, specifically mentioning Apple Inc. (AAPL) as one of the stocks in his portfolio. Shanda Asset Management holds a $116.5 million stake in AAPL. The article highlights Apple's positive financial growth, upcoming product launches with AI features, and collaborations with OpenAI. These factors are likely to be viewed positively by investors. However, the article also mentions that AAPL ranks 3rd on the list of stocks Chen Tianqiao dumped and bet on, suggesting that Chen might be reducing his exposure to AAPL. Considering the mixed signals, the overall sentiment seems slightly positive due to the emphasis on AI innovations and financial growth, but cautious due to the potential reduction in stake by a significant investor.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The news article discusses three Warren Buffett stocks with potential upside in 2025, including Apple Inc. (AAPL). According to Wedbush analyst Dan Ives, Apple's integration of artificial intelligence (AI) solutions into its products and its transformation as a services provider could boost consumer demand and enhance brand loyalty. Additionally, Apple's world-leading capital-return program has provided significant value to shareholders. However, the article also notes that Apple stock is historically pricey relative to its trailing-12-month EPS, which might be a concern for value investors. Considering the positive outlook from the analyst and the company's strong fundamentals, as well as the mixed but slightly positive sentiment from previous predictions, I estimate a higher probability of the stock price rising. The previous predictions show a range of opinions, with some models predicting a higher likelihood of the stock price falling due to negative news and downgrades, while others predict a higher likelihood of the stock price rising due to positive fundamentals and AI innovations. Taking into account the trend of others' beliefs and the provided information, I lean towards a slightly positive outlook.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.1, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.9, Reasoning: The financial news highlights multiple downgrades and lowered price targets due to weak iPhone sales and lackluster AI performance. Analysts expect lower-than-anticipated financial results, and current market trends show a negative sentiment towards the stock. The recent stock price drop further indicates investor concerns. While new product rollouts might provide some upside, the immediate impact of the negative news outweighs any potential positive developments.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article primarily discusses Warren Buffett's decision to sell General Motors (GM) stock and the author's disagreement with this move, highlighting GM's strong performance post-sale. While the article mentions Buffett reducing Berkshire's stake in Apple (AAPL), it does not provide any new negative information about Apple's fundamentals or performance. The focus remains on GM, and the tangential mention of Apple is unlikely to significantly impact AAPL's stock price. Given the lack of direct negative or positive news about Apple, the stock price is expected to remain relatively stable with a slight bias towards stability or minor fluctuations. Previous predictions show a mix of opinions, but the majority lean towards a neutral or slightly positive outlook for AAPL, considering the lack of impactful news directly related to the company.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "Warren Buffett Sold This Stock, but I Think He's Completely Wrong",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.5,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.5
}
```
